intro: Oxybasis rubra var. rubra, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, showy pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oxybasis rubra var. rubra is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
